data.title: [Feature] Add cached Scene.GetNodesByTags( tag ) and Node tags
data.body:
I found that @svifilabs realize this cool stuff.
https://github.com/svifylabs/Urho3D/commit/fbd6831cbd81ca3a382ec9033b292dff1c13f260

it's cool because it do caching all scene's nodes into vectors by tags and keep it in actual view. In this case it have a fastest way to get all scenes nodes marked with tags as: "enemy", "trigger", "npc" and so on...

data.title: [DX11] constant bias + slope bias
data.body: In DX9 I remember if I change one of them to -1 or 1 then object that will have this material will be always on top of then screen (always visible even if it far away from camera and occluded by others objects )(by Z-order). But if I change this values on DX11 no any changes.

data.title: [DX11] FillMode Point == Line
data.body: if you try to change fill mode to point fill it will be a same as line fill.

data.title: [Editor bug] selected light component rotation
data.body:
to reproduce this:
Open editor, load scene with 3-boxes, select node with light, select light component in Node and try to rotate around this node. Camera jump on huge distances far away. To solve this: click on Viewport properties on right bottom corner of editor window (gears icon) and press 
"reset camera"

data.title: [Feature] Add Node->Remove(TimeToDelete) & Scene->InstantiateXML(... lifeTime)
data.body: It very handy for objects with short life time, like bullets, missle... ect

data.title: Urho3D Editor Workflow speed enhancements
data.body:
- Pressing return key executes the top "Quick Action" result
- Windows toggle with the "Show ____" commands.
  - ie. CTRL+I toggles inspector visible/hidden

data.title: Add configuration of maximum layers in DynamicNavigationMesh
data.body:
- Valid range of 3 - 255
- Angelscript + Lua bindings
- Layer maximum changes only effects nav mesh build and does not trigger
  a build itself (as with other nav mesh parameters)

Reasoning behind the minimum value of 3 is that layers may occur inside of what the end user would expect to be a "watertight" shape when meshes are stacked on each other. 3 is a reasonably safe lower limit for a scene similar to the 39_CrowdNavigation example.

Default value of 16 is chosen as a reasonably low value that can still cover a "three story building on terrain with extra room for incidental interior layers in solid shapes."

Deals with issue #895

data.title: HoverBegin HoverEnd bug when resolution is changed
data.body:
A similar problem https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/issues/1010

HoverBegin HoverEnd dont call when resolution is changed in MouseClick event

Example:
https://gist.github.com/1vanK/3a097b11443296cf39b1

data.title: Camera farClip on Android
data.body:
I'm experimenting an issue with camera farClip on Android.

For example in sample 11_Physics, if I set Z position for the cubes above 130 then the pyramid doesn't show up (farClip is set to 500 in this sample).

As discussed in the forum (http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/post8938.html#p8938), I've tried to add some depth bits setting for the OpenGL ES depth buffer, but to no avail.

data.title: HoverBegin HoverEnd Bug
data.body:
Events HoverBegin and HoverEnd do not call when mouse cursor is hiding after click

Example:
https://drive.google.com/open?id=0B_XuF2wRVpw4X0xENUM4blAwNms

1) Run Game.exe. When mouse is hover texts, their color is changes.
2) Click "New Game"
3) Press Esc on keyboard.
4) When mouse hover "New Game", its color is changes, but when hover "Exit", its color is not changes.

I think it is related with DragNDropTest.

data.title: spine animation not properly report memory usage
data.body:
using sample 33's c++ source code. and change line 86 into
AnimationSet2D\* spriterAnimationSet = cache->GetResource("Urho2D/imp/spineboy.json");

spineboy.json is from
https://github.com/EsotericSoftware/spine-runtimes/tree/master/spine-c/data

If press F3 to report memory usage, Sprite2D and AnimationSet2D are both zero.

data.title: Add WEBP image format support
data.body: Saw this as feature request so I decided to implement it.

data.title: Add proper Z coordinate math to ParticleEmitter2D
data.body:
There is a bug related to Z-axis in ParticleEmitter2D.

![z](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/10887429/52205250-8187-11e5-95ef-d8f46f686569.png)

Basically here flowers are placed at z=0, particle = z=-2, animated coin z=-1
But particle ignore the Z axis and keep it on z = 0.

It should look like
![fix](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/10887543/e2e4c7c6-8187-11e5-9d59-79e0664edaf1.png)

data.title: Fix handling of indices in OBJ export
data.body: OBJ export now finds the lowest index of a geometry it's writing to adjust it's written indices against that. Necessary because only the vertices that are actually used by the geometry are written to the file which caused geometries that use index buffer offsets to be very unhappy.

data.title: bug in spine skeleton animation
Add missing world transformation in 2D particle emitter
Renderer2D draw order
data.body:
There is a bug related to layers if camera is non ortographic.
Basically if a sprite is under another one their Z is ignored.
Would be nice to keep layers when camera is ortographic and Z when is not.

![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/10873127/ab9a6c80-810f-11e5-9437-0066be0e40c8.png)
![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1329119/10873128/acaa174c-810f-11e5-880f-cd1397de80db.png)

data.title: RenderPath strange behaviour
data.body:
As i mentioned, in my topic - Render Path have a wierd behavior (by executing command path)
http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic1514.html

I made video to demonstrate this issue. 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=oyJ9SvOrwh8

In video i open scene, editor by default have DoF render path.
But it wierd looks. Like as some of commands of render path are missing.
I guessing because not all commands apply to renderer by some issue, or maybe (other my guessing) what the XMLParser have some problems with parsing.

And if i several times do selecting other RP and then try to choice the RP what i needed - it works as expected. This is not only editor problem I have a same behavior in my compiled project.

Also I do debug trace of my project. I look into (DoF) RP-commands one by one.
and find what the  command->outputs_ vector are always empty,  even if I have custom or "viewport" output RT for quad command. Is this normal ? maybe this "outputs_" only for MRT rendering?

data.title: More UV-coords
data.body:
Now mdl format support 2 UV sets of UV-coords. In some cases need more UV-coords, max 4 - typical scenario: RGB-masking (RGB mask, R-channel texture, G-channel texture, B-channel texture,), (may be more - 8).
Need change format of mdl to support more UV coords, change asset importers code to support this feature and write converter to new mdl format.
